title: Mining Safety Baselines
description: This file contains safety baseline metrics for mining operations, including incidence rates, fatalities, and TRIFR. Units vary by source: MSHA incidence rates are per 200,000 hours; ICMM TRIFR is per 1,000,000 hours; BLS fatal injury rates are per 100,000 full-time equivalent (FTE) workers. Use care when comparing rates across sources; convert to a common basis (e.g., per 1,000,000 hours) when presenting combined charts.

notes: Units vary by source: MSHA incidence rates are per 200,000 hours; ICMM TRIFR is per 1,000,000 hours; BLS fatal injury rates are per 100,000 full-time equivalent (FTE) workers.
MSHA Jan–Sep 2024 figures are labeled 'PRELIMINARY' by MSHA and may be revised.
ICMM covers member companies (~one‑third of global mining); figures are not global totals for the entire mining industry.
Use care when comparing rates across sources; convert to a common basis (e.g., per 1,000,000 hours) when presenting combined charts.

definitions.incidence_rate_per_200k_hours: Number of recordable injuries and illnesses per 200,000 employee hours worked. (MSHA definition)
definitions.TRIFR_per_1M_hours: Total Recordable Injury Frequency Rate: recordable injuries per 1,000,000 hours worked. (ICMM definition)
definitions.fatal_injury_rate_per_100k_FTE: Annual workplace fatal injury rate per 100,000 full-time equivalent workers. (BLS CFOI)
definitions.NFDL: Nonfatal injuries with days lost (lost time).
definitions.NDL: Nonfatal injuries with no days lost (no lost time).

conversion_helpers.per_200k_hours_to_per_1M_hours: Multiply by 5. Example: 1.912 per 200k hours ≈ 9.56 per 1,000,000 hours.
conversion_helpers.per_100k_FTE_to_per_1M_hours: Not directly convertible without hours-per-FTE assumption; avoid converting.

suggested_claim_text: In the US, MSHA recorded 28 mining fatalities in 2024, down from 40 in 2023. (source: MSHA)
Among ICMM member companies, there were 42 fatalities in 2024 and a TRIFR of 2.29 per 1,000,000 hours worked. (source: ICMM)
In BLS data for 2023, the Mining, Quarrying, and Oil & Gas sector’s fatal work injury rate was 16.9 per 100,000 FTE workers (113 deaths). (source: BLS CFOI)
MSHA preliminary Jan–Sep 2024 incidence rates were ~3.05 per 200,000 hours for coal and ~1.91 per 200,000 hours across metal/nonmetal mines, mills, and shops. (source: MSHA Part 50)
